body:
**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**

Ceph dashboard should work out of the box even with https disabled.

**Expected behavior:**

A few manual tweaks are required.

**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**

As hinted in [this issue](https://github.com/rook/rook/issues/2809#issuecomment-472666545) the [config code](https://github.com/rook/rook/blob/master/pkg/operator/ceph/cluster/mgr/config.go#L46-L53) for the port still looks like this:
```
func (c *Cluster) dashboardPort() int {
	if c.dashboard.Port == 0 {
		// select default port
		return dashboardPortHTTPS
	}
	// crd validates port >= 0
	return c.dashboard.Port
}
```

This sets the default port to `dashboardPortHTTPS`, no matter if `c.dashboard.SSL` is enabled or not.

Please default to `dashboardPortHTTP` if `c.dashboard.SSL` is disabled.

----

Furthermore the [Code](https://github.com/rook/rook/blob/master/pkg/operator/ceph/cluster/mgr/spec.go#L323) will always create a port `https-dashboard` even if no https is involved.

This is not only very misleading, but also makes ingress controllers like [traefik](https://docs.traefik.io/configuration/backends/kubernetes/#tls-communication-between-traefik-and-backend-pods) assume communication using https. (And therefore breaks the ingress.)

Please only prefix `https` if `c.dashboard.SSL` is enabled.

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Container Linux
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration: bare metal
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod): v1.0.6 / master
* Storage backend version (e.g. for ceph do `ceph -v`): 13.2.2
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift): typhoon
title: Dashboard port / service very missleading
